However, the military operates off a 24-hour clock, beginning at midnight (which is 0000 hours). So, 1 AM is zero one hundred (0100) hours, 2 AM is zero two hundred (0200) hours, and so on up until 11 PM which is 2300 hours. After noon (1200 hours) to translate the regular time in the afternoon and evening, you simply add 12 hours to be within military standards. For instance, 1 PM is 1300 hours and 5 PM is 1700 hours.

https://www.thebalancecareers.com/military-time-3356971

However, the military operates off a 24-hour clock, beginning at midnight (which is 0000 hours). So, 1 AM is zero one hundred (0100) hours, 2 AM is zero two hundred (0200) hours, and so on up until 11 PM which is 2300 hours. After noon (1200 hours) to translate the regular time in the afternoon and evening, you simply add 12 hours to be within military standards. For instance, 1 PM is 1300 hours and 5 PM is 1700 hours.
